alternative_title: Health and safety consultations at work
body:
$!
By law, you must consult with your employees or their representatives on health and safety issues at work.
$!

You must consult about:

* new measures or equipment that will substantially affect your employees' health and safety at work
* getting competent people to help you comply with health and safety requirements (eg health and safety officers)
* risks and dangers in the workplace and how health and safety measures address them
* health and safety training
* introducing new technology that could affect your employee's health and safety

##How the consultation process works

You consult with employees by:

* listening to their concerns 
* sharing information
* considering what your employees say before you make decisions

The law does not set out when employers must consult, or for how long. However, you must allow enough time for your employees to consider the matters being raised and give an informed response.
overview: Consulting your staff on health and safety issues at work including new plans or measures, equipment, training and new technology
